title: Patch Chat with the Playtest Team: 6.17, the Pre-Worlds Patch
body:
Hey guys! Welcome to Patch Chat, a Dev Corner thread we make to talk about the new patch every two weeks.

I'm Aesah on Riot's Playtest Team, a group of Diamond+ players who play with the new champions, reworks, balance tweaks, items, and map updates before they are released. It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to LoL in terms of both balance and fun. We'll be around for the next few hours to answer as many questions as we can.

In 6.17, we're nerfing a few champions that have had an overbearing presence (pick/ban rate) in professional play. Specifically, S-tier junglers Gragas and Rek'sai who have been crowding out other options are both taking a hit. In the ADC role, Ashe/Sivir/Jhin are losing a bit of power while some other ADCs get minor buffs to bring them more in line with each other. Finally, Gangplank and Trundle are getting nerfs as well- Gangplank in particular taking a heavier hit due to how strong of a pick he has been for awhile. These powerhouses have been making teams uninterested in other choices when they've been available, so we hope that taking them down a notch will allow teams to feel comfortable picking a wider variety of champions and bring some new dynamics on to the Rift.

All of us on the Playtest Team are avid gamers so feel free to talk to us as fellow LoL players!

Adam "Afic" Cohen
Preston “Hinder” Bunker
Ben “Cezium” Burkhardt
Shawn “I Am The IRS” Currie
Don “Aesah” Ding
Nicolas “Gleeb” Haddad
Dan “Penguin” Hardison

Bao “Bao” Lam

I'd honestly wouldnt mind a refund because essentially you guys are excuse my language. Fucking over your whole playerbase, because of 100 players.

We're looking at nerfing Shen due to his extremely high pick/ban rate in pro play. I would expect the Shen nerfs currently on PBE to drop his normal/ranked winrate by a couple percent so he'd still be completely playable for anyone (I would expect Shen players to lose 1 more game out of every 50 games on average, which is not particularly disastrous especially considering his normal/ranked winrate is reasonably close to 50% right now). 

I'd advise against using hyperbole because when someone thinks that a medium-sized nerf to 1 champion qualifies as "fucking over our entire playerbase", it's very hard to respond to that in any meaningful manner except "no, it doesnt?" but that just feels like stating the obvious to me.

It's not a medium sized nerf though, it's a huge one. His Q is literally the only thing in his kit that he can use to deal damage (and even then the damage he deals falls off incredibly hard outside of lane phase). I can understand nerfing the percent health damage, but nerfing the damage to minions and monsters is incredibly ridiculous. Most Shens don't even buy a single damage item, so now you're cutting the damage on his Q to minions by over 25% at rank 5? If that's not huge, I don't know what is. 

Also, if you want to disrupt his impact in pro play, why are you nerfing his damage, instead of the actual reason why he's picked? Shen is not picked to be a lane dominant champion or to carry out of top lane like someone such as Riven or Fiora, he's picked for his ultimate and his taunt. Nerfing his damage is akin to having a hole in a ship, and instead of fixing the hole, you make another one so that the first is no longer your focus. He will still be picked in pro play, he will still be pick/ban, and meanwhile the people outside of competitive will have to deal with atrocious waveclear and damage. It's hard enough as is to do well with Shen (especially in lower ELO where your teammates run away as soon as you ult them or don't stand in your W) and now the only part of his kit that allows him to actually do a little bit of damage and survive on his own is being nerfed? 

Also, one more thing I'd like to discuss while you're here is the sheer difference between competitive play and normal play, and how so many champions (Rek'Sai, Gragas, Nidalee, Gangplank, Sivir, Azir, and now Shen, and the list goes on and on and on...) are nerfed because of their near constant use in the LCS. To me, this is something that is not only unfair to people outside of competitive, but also indirectly deceptive and malicious. The fact that many of these champions are only most effectively utilized in the highest tiers of play and are nerfed for the rest of the playerbase to compensate facilitates and emphasizes the discrepancy between what is seen by the average player in LCS and what the average player actually plays. This is unhealthy for the game, plain and simple. I shouldn't have to feel that a certain champion is not viable in my ELO simply because the pros abuse and min/max the champion in ways that I cannot. This will always be a problem unless either somehow professional League undergoes major changes, such as imposing limits in some way to what champions can or cannot be played or the entire balance system having a Plat+ balance and a Gold- balance. The fact that League is balanced around the top 5% of all players mean that, for the other 95%, the game has the potential to become unbalanced. Obvious, yes, but it seem like the balance team never addresses this, even though it's probably one of the most important issues in the game. 

In summary: I should not have to suffer Shen nerfs that are aimed at professional play when I'm in a vastly different tier, playing what feels like a completely different game.

Another thing to keep in mind is that while you guys are free to ask questions about anything, this is Patch Chat 6.17 where we haven't touched Shen. The PBE is a PBE for a reason; not all of the changes on it necessarily go through- the changes you see to Shen there aren't final.

That being said, I'm pretty sure we're going to be handing him a nerf, just not sure of the extent.
I recognize and understand that. I was simply looking for some context as to why Worlds balance somehow circumvents balance for the rest of the playerbase, but I guess I won't find that answer here.

Because figuring out how to change champions fundamentally is something that takes a large amount of time and isn't taken lightly. There's a lot of questions to ask:

1) Do these characters need a full scale rework? Or just small scope stuff (think Annie or the lesser Mid-Year Mage updates) 

2) Do designers want to support multiple playstyles for champions? Or pidgeonhole them into one direct build? (This is something that is debated _constantly_ because it's a player pain point when fun builds are basically destroyed, even when they're pretty clearly unhealthy for the game (Tank Yasuo/Tank Ekko/Triforce ekko) 

3) Players typically respond horribly to removal of features, even when these features make champions overbearing. Think original Azir who had way too much in his kit. Remove his E knockup and he's *still* too good? Can designers just remove mechanics without murdering the original identity of the champion? 

etc etc

and I'm just on playtest -- the designers talk about all of this & more constantly. It's an unending conversation.

If shens whole ''broken too much presence and impact '' because his ult, why are we nerfing his Q..? His wave clear is so horrible that i legit think vayne has more until you get a tit.hydra or sunfire even then its ''ok..''  at best...

Nerf his ult, Not his Q. Nerfing his Q just shows that the people who vouch for it never actually played shen. His Q damage is horrible after the 10 minute mark.

Because we're targeting his weakness, not nerfing his strengths. When we start nerfing champions strengths they begin to homogenize as they lose their strategic identities. If we nerfed Shen's ult, players wouldn't pick Shen for the global pressure he brings - they'd just pick him if his ball of stats was greater than someone else's.

Now this of course ends up with the question of how do you nerf something who's niche is so powerful in competitive and leads to hitting his weaknesses. By nerfing his Q and in essence damaging his waveclear, there's now a tradeoff for having such a powerful global ultimate. You are no longer capable of splitpushing like a monster while simultaneously providing the best global pressure in the game.

While I appreciate the clarification regarding the thought process behind the nerf, personally, it doesn't seem like a terribly effective way to balance him. The vast majority of Shen's waveclear is purchased. Sunfire's the big one, but there's also Titanic Hydra, Zz'Rot, and even Banner of Command. Anything that lets him effectively splitpush is purchased, not tied to his Q.

(There's also he semi-meta issue of "Well, if he can't push waves, what's the point of him being on his own, and in turn, having a global ult?" but that gets a bit complicated/speculative). 

If him being able to CS early on is an issue, make it completely unable to damage minions, force my little low-elo Shen soul learn how to CS properly. I'd rather be able to do *any* damage to my opponent early on then have a csing/waveclear crutch. It would completely kill jungle Shen, but the nerfs as they are do that anyway.

It's just a mix of frustrating and concerning, reading what Riot's trying to actually achieve with these changes, and how they think it will impact him. Removing 15-20% of a Shen's single target damage against champions,  so he has worse waveclear, is an _extremely_ brute force solution that will hurt solo players far more then the pro niche it's targeted at.

Well for one it has hurt his waveclear based on the playtests we've run. I didn't think it was going to make much of a difference, but I definitely felt the weaker waveclear. In addition, in competitive play he's not buying most of the other things beyond Sunfire until much later in the game. Part of the goal for these changes is to force more of his itemization purchases towards waveclear.

But it is possible we do need to focus more of the bonus damage to minions, although that likely disproportionately effects low elo than high elo (who are generally much better at cs'ing)

That's... encouraging? Probably the wrong word. Lessens my feeling of Riot blindly stat-smashing.

To combine this with a response with one to another reply you made to me about him not being about the damage: Sure, he's never been about the damage. He's arguably not really about being a tank, given that his base stats are 1-2 rune pages worse then most other tanks. He's about those moments when your macro play is on point, you ult someone who's getting 3 vs 1 dove under a tower, and you turn a certain death into a triple kill for your team. You get the joy of like an entire match playing support for a good team condensed into your team mate going  "SHEN GOD! FUCK YEAH!".

But those are moments. Laning makes up a ton of actual gameplay by time spent, and Shen's got so many losing match ups in lane right now. So many people building Black Cleaver, or dealing true damage, or spamming 15 dashes when he's only got one (hi Yasuo), or they're just simply a ranged champion. One of the only ways you can deal with that is, bluntly, to outplay them - to score the pull through, to hold on to your dash for the perfect moment to taunt them into taking tower shots. etc. Nerfing the sword pull through in particular is really concerning to me, since it reduces the reward for outplaying your opponent, and in turn makes his laning phase even more of a slog. 

(Doesn't matter if Q can 1-shot minions if you have to eat a full skill rotation each time you try to do anything other than cs under tower, since you deal zero damage) 

I wouldn't mind it if any of his skills functionally scaled with stats, but they don't, so it's not like I've really got the recourse of "Well, you can build aggressively! AP Shen mah brutha!" if these nerfs go through. (Some) folks at /r/Shen have had some luck basically just slapping AD assassin/bruiser items on him, but that seems like such a depressing failure of design if I've got to build a BF sword to do more that 3% of someone's health in lane. At that point it seems like you're far better off just playing Tahm Kench to (functionally - I realize it's based on Kench's health) get Shen's Q damage as a passive, a methadone version of his ult, and far better base stats.

> If shens whole ''broken too much presence and impact '' because his ult, why are we nerfing his Q..? His wave clear is so horrible that i legit think vayne has more until you get a tit.hydra or sunfire even then its ''ok..'' at best...

That's important, otherwise his intended strategic identity is just too strong to be in the game. Champions should have weaknesses. Nerfing Shen's ultimate would nerf the main reason he's actually picked and what makes shen cool.

Yes but if you nerf him to the point where he's nothing but an ult bot, what then? The same thing has happened to Rek'Sai, she's literally just a vision/knockup bot now. Don't ruin a champion because they are too strong at the competitive level. That's not a good philosophy and is unhealthy for the game as a whole.

So...Riot finally admits Ekko's design is problematic and might need something _other_ than number changes?

I...love you.

>It's our job to the test the changes that our designers come up with and ensure that we're introducing positive changes to LoL in terms of both balance and fun.

In addition to the "boring" picks, whenever the LCS is stale, Riot appears to  nerf and buff just to have something new show up, even when non-professional games have a stable meta with for the most part, healthy picks in decent spots.

"Who chooses which champs should be buffed and nerfed for competitive."
"do you guys have internal metrics on wanting to make champs competitive?"

This patch I'm working on the team that does this, it's our Live Balance team. We have a meeting at the beginning of every patch to talk about what we think should be worked on for the following patch. We use data pulled from competitive games and ranked games along with information from various high Elo players, people from our eSports department, other designers and sometimes pro players.

"With a few tiny buffs maybe you can change these guys from being troll picks to competitive picks. I would love to see new champions every year at worlds"

That's a large part of what we are trying to do in patch 6.17 and 6.18. We aren't trying to force a champion into pro play, but if they were on the edge of being picked we are looking to make them slightly more appealing. 

"I'm just wondering if you guys are actively trying to get all champs viable for competitive"

We are trying to expand the pool of viable competitive champions but we currently aren't trying to get every champion into pro play.
